answerText: type III survivorship curve[10] In survivorship tables, an individual's "potential" value for this quantity is represented by m sub x, which equals the reserve of vitellogenic oocytes. The "realized" form of this quantity, m sub x times l sub x, equals the number of offspring produced.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Dartmouth A, Penn C | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this curve followed by r-selected species. Organisms with this kind of survivorship curve have high mortality early in life but live for a relatively long time after reaching adulthood.
